NEW YORK STATE EDUCATIONAL RADIO AND TELEVISION ASSOCIATION
Report of the Television Station Activation Committee
April 5, 1963
1, Statewide meeting of community leaders: The committee recommends
the following Resolution for consideration by the general membership:
"RESOLVED, that the President of the New York State
Educational Radio and Television Association, in
cooperation with the Commissioner of Education of
New York State, invite community leaders, legislators
and other interested people from key areas in New York
State to attend an informational meeting, at which time
the State plans for educational television and other
aspects of educational television might be explained
by a high level representative from the New York State
Governmentâ€¢"
2. Survey of local institutions and councils engaged in educational
television:
The Committee recommends a survey of all stations, councils,
institutions of higher learning and any other educational television agency,
in order that those who are planning to activate a station, institute or
form a council, or produce programs over local commercial stations might
have specific information available concerning other operations in the
State*
The survey will be duplicated by the State Education Department
of New York under the sponsorship of N.Y.S.E.R.T.A. It will be distributed
to anyone in the State who requests such information from an existing council
or station or from the State Education Department.
The survey will include: The kinds, types and sources of educational
television programs produced and broadcast in New York State; staffing;
operating budget analysis; initial and present capital outlay; composition
of Board of Trustees; program and finance committee structure and function;
and brief narrative history of the organization.
In accordance with the above, the Television Station Activation
Committee recommends that the general membership vote the following Resolution
"RESOLVED, that NYSERTA begin a survey of various councils
and institutions regarding personnel, budget, legal composition,
programing, and any other information which might prove to be
of value to individual members of the association and those
individuals or groups making plans to begin work in educational
television broadcasting."
